snippet: Kansas City, which missed the playoffs for the 27th year in a row, has made a major sacrifice in executing the next phase of its plan, trading the minor league player of the year to the Rays for two starters.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column analyzes decision by Kansas City Royals to trade outfielder Wil Myers to Tampa Bay Rays for pitchers James Shields and Wade Davis; holds Royals, weary of defeat, are trading long term prospects for immediate gains.
lead_paragraph: Kansas City, which missed the playoffs for the 27th year in a row, has made a major sacrifice in executing the next phase of its plan, trading the minor league player of the year to the Rays for two starters.

headline.print_headline: Royals Trade the Future for Now
headline.seo: Royals Trade the Future for Now
headline.main: Royals Trade the Future for Now
